Reviews.Title: “Anastasia”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, decent size, friendly staff and good value for money. Good quality room, quiet, international TV, good free WIFI. Good location, however it is far for the center. There are a lot of restorants near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrijay
Reviews.Content: The only reason this hotel is still doing well is because of the business people who need to be close to Maria de Molina and Pinar. The hotel staff hardly speak English and can be quite rude. The food is below average and for the price you have to pay at this hotel, you can get eloborate meals at good restaurants downtown. Stay away if you can.

Reviews.Title: “conveniently located - nice - friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: InternetUser42
Reviews.Content: We stayed there two nights for a short city trip and it was a really nice stay. The hotel is located not too far away from the historical city center, there are subway stations for two different lines near only a 3-5min walk away. WIth the subway you reach the central "Puerta del Sol" in under 10 minutes. In the surrounding streets there are multiple restaurants and bars, also a supermarket is only a few meters away. it really conveniently located for tourists visiting Madrid. Our room was surprisingly spacious for the location, also the bathroom is quite large and has windows, i.e. daylight. All was clean and comfortable, no complaints. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the committment they showed towards us was surely high class: Unfortunately we got robbed (in the city, not in the hotel) and they helped us calling and speaking to the police, agreeing on delayed payment (no money and no credit cards left :-( ) was also no problem at all, very good service! During the three days we stayed there we only dealt with staff that could speak very good english, we had no problems at all communicating though we don't speak any spanish at all. I highly recommend this hotel for tourists visiting the city of Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised.....”
Reviews.Author: eliott69
Reviews.Content: I was allocated this hotel thru last minute.com's secret hotel deal. Upon finding out the name and reading some reviews I was expecting the worse...... but gladly that wasnt the case. staff on arrival were very helpful, spoke good english to my pigeon spanish. Room was fine.... not my choice of colour decoration but i'm not on holiday to spend time in my room.Bathroom was fine, excellent shower. Good location, close to 2 metro stations and also within walking distance of everywhere. Basically its very good value for the price..... I think some reviewers have overlooked this when writing.....

Reviews.Title: “nice stay in the Madrid center”
Reviews.Author: silencd
Reviews.Content: It is starred as 4, but I shall give 3. Located in a business district, the hotel is in the good access to metro and in a short distance to every where. It is not brand new, and here and there you find the worn details, but every thing works well. Clean. Breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: silviahg
Reviews.Content: I usually like NH hotels but this one formerly Hesperia and now managed by NH was not a very good choice. Location is ok, close to underground station Gregorio Marañon (line 10) or Ruben Dario (line 5) and some buses. Also, close to Serrano street. However the hotel is far from a 4 stars. It's so classic. Rooms are small and if you don't say anything you could finish in a room with a 135 cm bed (pretty small for these days). Breakfast is not so bad but where is Anti OX breakfast, so many advertised by the hotel? Poor variety and queues in the morning. Staff is so stressed that you ask for a boiled egg and you wait forever!! Price was good but I would not return to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “it is a bit of a tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: JasonWD
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel through lastminute.com as a 'secret hotel' and to be honest I have seen better. Basically it is a bit of a tired hotel; clean, but with rough edges and staff that seem to be quite jaded. Bad points: Timber flooring makes for a cold un-homely feeling and is extremely irritating when someone upstairs starts dragging the furniture around at 7:30 on a sunday. The heating, while it worked, sounded like an old car so we shut it off at night and froze. Television was only available in Spanish. CNN and BBC were available but it was impossible to change the Spanish dubbed american programs to VO like normal digital TVs The Location is not great for visiting the city, unless you need to take the Metro or Taxi to the centre Good Point(s): Free WiFi - It does seem though, that it is a 512K connection shared between the whole hotel (I tested it). I only got useable service at 5AM, otherwise it was below dialup speed. In conclusion; we won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: heiranig
Reviews.Content: Although a bit outdated in the decor, the hotel is well located in the financial district of Madrid, within walking distance of museums, shops and restaurants. I enjoyed their plentiful and fresh breakfast in the morning and the clean and comfortable room. The shower was broken (water leaking from the shower head) and a bit inconvenient (water coming out and splashing the floor) but the bathroom is of good size and equipped with good amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal - great location, great room, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: radiodave102FM
Reviews.Content: Visited the hotel for a week in August 2010 and we were both delighted by the high standards here. The staff are very friendly and helpful, and our lack of Spanish language skills was not a problem at all. The rooms are a good size, and the beds enormously comfortable, though perhaps a little modernising is needed there are no problems. The bathrooms are epic, and well equipped. Breakfast is a buffet, served from 8am to an impressive 11am with a great choice of pastries and hot food. In terms of location, its just a short and simple metro ride into the city centre (the metro costs 1euro a trip and is a 3 minute walk from the hotel. Top tips... leaving the hotel, follow the road to the right where you will find a great Italian restaurant (next to the amusingly named THONGS chinese). Hotel bar and mini bar prices are of course extortionate... BUT.... if you exit the hotel and turn left, follow the road past the chinese and to the italian, turn right and walk up the hill. Take your first left, and continue up the hill (five mins max) there is an internet cafe on the right and a SUPERMARKET on the left which sells everything you could need for a fraction of the price ! Finally... don't be caught out by the bars near the hotel, they charge upwards of 10 euros for a simple drink! Head into the city or drink in one of the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel nice location”
Reviews.Author: marcel dam
Reviews.Content: We styayed here in may 2010. Its a nice hotel with spacious, clean room, staff is friendly and helpfull. They offer a great breakfast and have a nice bar. Located for business but tourist stuff is eassy to reach by public transport or taxi's. You can also do it on foot. I didnt speak spanisch but that was no problem. all in all good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: g8-1tourguest
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. It is not really close to any of the main sights in Madrid. But does have a metro station Gregario Maranon close by and goes direct to Plaza de Espanya, where there are a lot of sights to see and shopping. Also took a taxi to royal palace from here and it took maybe 13 minutes and cost 8euros. Room was nice could be cleaner. Ask for room away from front entrance due to narrow street, cars are honking there horns all night. Bottom floor rooms did have sewer smell. Upon request staff would let us use computers for no charge for a short time. Staff were nice and helpful. Breakfast had a good selection and was good.

Reviews.Title: “Uneven Quality”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: We experienced both good and bad during our stay at the Hesperia Emperatriz. I would not recommend this hotel for those who speak no Spanish or who are picky about their hotels. The problems at this hotel may require that you speak with hotel staff frequently, sometimes daily, which may be more challenging for those with no knowledge of Spanish. The Good Some Service -- we had good service from a number of members of the hotel staff. We found the service to be particularly good in the restaurant and at times at the front desk, where some staff were very helpful to us on different occasions. Room and Bathroom -- Our room was nice and had hardwood floors. The bathroom was quite large with double sinks. The tub/shower was acceptable, although the glass pane blocking water did not work well. As a result, showers generally left the bathroom floor wet. The Bad We experienced a number of problems at the Hesperia Emperatriz: Internet -- the Internet service was often effectively nonfunctional during our stay. The hotel has free wifi, but the Internet service is at best really bad. If you are in town for business and need reliable Internet access, do not choose this hotel. If you want to browse websites or send email with any degree of predictability, do not choose this hotel. I waited on multiple occasions for consumer websites such as airline websites to load. These sites often did not load after 30 minutes or more of waiting. I had difficulty downloading and uploading documents and sending emails from my local email client and Gmail. At ti mes, the Internet service was a bit faster, but it was much slower than Internet access at places other than the hotel. Smoke -- our room, which were were told was on a non-smoking floor, frequently smelled like smoke. When we inquired at the front desk we were told that smoking was permitted on the third and sixth floors, which means that sometimes guests on other floors smelled smoke. If you are sensitive to smoke, this is probably not the best choice hotel for you. Housekeeping -- housekeeping was inconsistent during our stay. At times housekeeping was fine. At other times, some items were not provided. We did not have any towels one day and did not have any hand soap on another day. On some days housekeeping did not clear away dirty glasses. Room Keys -- We had to receive new room keys on 3 occasions during our stay because our previous keys stopped working.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel though could do with an update”
Reviews.Author: Begonia21
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a 3 day business trip. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were a great size and seeing as it was only a 2 minute walk to the office a perfect location for that. Though not long in a taxi to the centre. The only thing for me was that the rooms could do with a bit of an update as the decor seemed a bit out-dated. Otherwise had a pleasant stay here. Though would most probably suite an older crowd.

Reviews.Title: “ideal for business trip”
Reviews.Author: Terence_Hill
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night during a business trip. The hotel is located just next to the big Paseo de la Castellana in a side street. My room was a “Pink Lady”-room with a bathrobe, slippers and bathing soap for women. The room was very spacious with a big bed. I was very satisfied and would stay there again. It is a 4-star hotel. If you wish to have more luxury, you should choose the 5-star-brother Hesperia Madrid in Paseo de la Castellana 57, just a few steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: gisaster25
Reviews.Content: My double room was great -- quiet, very clean, tastefully decorated, and had a large bathroom stocked with amenities like slippers and a bounty of toiletries. The pillows and linens were fresh and crisp. The only drawback with the room is that the bed was a bit small for two people; it was only slightly larger than a double bed. The hotel itself is well situated one block from the metro and a Starbucks, although the surrounding area is not particularly interesting. Some of the front desk staff were rather unfriendly and seemed to resent my speaking English or asking them to arrange restaurant reservations. There was an incident that was especially unprofessional: an older guest was standing just outside the front doors -- in plain view of the reception desk some 10 metres away -- with some large suitcases. She looked distressed and said she'd been waiting for a doorman to appear for 10-15 minutes to help hold open the heavy glass doors and pull her bags up the step and into the lobby. I went inside and interrupted chatting employees at the reception desk to inform them that this woman needed help... and I was waved away with "Yes -- that's for the doorman". That is, they knew this woman needed help, clearly saw her through the glass door in front of them, and declined to walk five paces to help her or locate the absent doorman, instead turning their backs to chat amongst themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for leisure or bussiness”
Reviews.Author: jpgjpg
Reviews.Content: I'm staying in Madrid, in Hotel Emperatriz (Hesperia group) since February (normally, 2 a 3 nights per week). It's an old building that have been converted to an hotel. it has a retro design, very cosy, very nice. The hotel have 21 rooms per floor. There are rooms bigger than other and some facing the street and others facing a backyard. The interior rooms are more quite. I prefered rooms facing the street in the 7th floor. Very nice breakfast, wi fi internet free and good amenities for Hesperia|one (frequent) clients.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice”
Reviews.Author: TrevD
Reviews.Content: This is a 4 star hotel in the embassy/upmarket shopping district of Madrid. its quiet there at night which is important given the late night traffic noise you can get elsewhere in Madrid. Its easy to get here form the metro with the nearest station just 4 or 5 minutes walks form the hotel. Rooms are a decent size and the hotel also offers free wi-fi which is great. Breakfast is expensive so if you're not a big breakfast person you may prefer to take breakfast elsewhere. I got a double room for 60 euro which was a real bargain. Only drawback is that its a bit of a walk to the central tourist area from here.

Reviews.Title: “doubts about the Emperatriz”
Reviews.Author: rosstucker
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad hotel -- but for the price it's not a good hotel: it has deteriorated since we last stayed there five years ago. This time we had air conditioning problems in our room; the door card did not work properly day after day; the hall carpets are worn and a little dirty, and the room itself was a bit worn and damaged in places. On the other hand, the location is convenient, the breakfast is good (but expensive), and the staff are generally quite welcoming. Word has it that the hotel is being rented to the Hesperia chain -- which has a five-star establishment across the street. They need to take a close look at the Emperatriz -- and bring it up to standard!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room and the hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: Gordi79
Reviews.Content: At the begining was a little worried about going there because of some stories I have heard about the hotel from friends that stayed there before but that was before Hesperia took over the hotel. The room we got was GREAT (an we were 3 people staying there). Even the Extra Bed was fabulous. The staff was friendly and the breakfast was one of the best I ever had in spain. As it was a triple room with extra bed the hotel staff placed every day extra toiletries (enough for even 5 People) and made sure that extra towels for the 3rd person were there. The hotel bathroom had a bidet, which I personally find very useful. The view we got was a little nice courtyard, the AC was working perfectly and the location of the hotel is fantastic! only 3 minutes walk to the metro station and honestly...even if your hotel is at the "Puerta del Sol" you need to take the underground to move. Taxis are cheap but the traffict in the city is horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel for City Break”
Reviews.Author: dskeeles
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Emperatriz for 3 nights on business. Admittedly, I worked in the room most nights, and only saw my room, breakfast room, and reception. Overall, service was good and efficient, and politely friendly. My room was an interesting shape, with a short entrance corridor. There was a minibar with standard selection, the bathroom was clean and modern, with the soaps, etc. being pretty good. The TV had a mix of European channels, although it was pretty old and I never managed to get any sound on it! I had to unplug it in any case to plug in my laptop. Overall, it was a fine hotel; not outstanding, but I was pleased enough to stay there. The one thing that struck me was the breakfast. Standard selection of continental, cold meats, etc... but the quality was excellent. The croissants were the best I've tasted in a hotel for ages, and I expect the rest was just as good. This implied to me that attention to detail on the various aspects I didn't sample would be equally good.

Reviews.Title: “Great smaller hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: ontravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Emperatriz for four nights in September. It's located in the upscale Salamanca area with a Metro stop five minutes away. I emailed in advance to make sure we had an exterior room on a high floor and that's exactly what we got. The room was lovely, nicely decorated and clean with a large window overlooking a small park. Because it's on a small street off Paseo de Castellano, there's little traffic noise. The hotel staff were pleasant and most spoke some English. Would definitely stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Relax...”
Reviews.Author: Mary000
Reviews.Content: Found the Empiratriz very comfortable and relaxing. The room was lovely with minibar etc... though no tea/coffee facilities! Breakfast was good and the area has lots going for it.
